loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is 42 years old and a very hardworking and honest lady. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a responsible mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband owns a shoe shop in the market in which he sells shoes for all age groups.

She has requested a loan for her husband's shop, as he is interested to purchase a variety of shoes to sell. With the profit she will put aside some savings for their children's future.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes to sell

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. Jaafar is the only provider for the family.

Jaafar is a mechanic. He established his business in 2004 and now he has an employee. He has built a good experience in this field and he has an excellent reputation in his area.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy equipment specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children with a good education and better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment specialized for his work.

loans.name: Amanjol

texts.en:
Mr.Amanjol is a 31-year-old single man who lives with his sister's family in her house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. 

The borrower has graduated from secondary school, and started working at a construction company as an assistant interior designer. He is planning to start his own interior design service business. 

He is now requesting 3'000'000MNT to purchase inventory and some tools to start his own business, working with local customers. 

He is a hardworking, diligent, and modest man who says, "I am trying to save to move out of my sister's house, get married, and start my own life."

loans.use: to purchase inventory and some tools to start his own interior design business for local customers.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie is 28 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is nine and the youngest is two. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Recently, she established another business, a restaurant, which has been running for three months. She wants a loan to buy goods to use in her restaurant such as rice, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil, milk, etc. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil, milk, etc..for her new restraurant.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is aged thirty three and is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who are both at school. Alex has been in farming for the past fourteen years, producing milk, poultry and horticultural products which he sells to the people in his local area. He also owns a motorbike for transportation as an additional source of income.

He is requesting for 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will give him more milk produce and earn him extra income which will help uplift his livelihood and use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling, he aspires to have redoubled his production in the next five years.

Unreliable rainfall and poor markets are his major challenges in farming.

Alex is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving him the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Warlito Jr.

texts.en: Warlito, a 32-year old, is a married man of Upper Pulacan, Labangan who has 2 children and is earning from his private transport service business. It started almost 3 years ago and he earns 8,000 a month. To improve business, he would like to borrow 50,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, in order to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Mwitanzige Village Bank Group

texts.en: Julius is a 28 year old hardworking man with two children living in Hioma, Uganda. In order to support his growing family he decided to venture into produce business and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees and construct a house for residence. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluction pose a challenge to his business growth while his desire is to own a food store. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Julius intends to use the loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Izo

texts.en: Izo is from the Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 53 years old, a widow and lives with her daughter and son. Izo’s daughter works as a teacher at the local school and gets a monthly salary. Izo runs an agricultural business. In particular, she owns a calf and two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. Izo produces cheese and sells it locally. Also, they have a vineyard and a plot of land, where nuts are grown. The family completes all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. Izo works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to build her savings and improve the living conditions of her family. She has requested a loan to renovate her house. Her existing house is old and damaged. Izo will purchase building materials and repair her home. Then, the living conditions of her family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Izo hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Yvone

texts.en: Yvone is 30 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is two. Her husband is unemployed. She has been in business for nine years. She wants a loan to buy more hair product for clients. The profit will assist her to finish her house.

loans.use: To buy more hair products for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married and has three children. She is 65 years old and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Rufina owns and operates a farm, planting, harvesting and selling corn to earn a living. She's been in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of business. 

Rufina requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Rufina been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay is from Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 39 years old, is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Jay owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. Jay has been engaged in his business for 6 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Jay joined GDMPC. Jay is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used  to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and pay the school tuition for his children.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha is 41 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 7. Her husband is her partner in business. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy goods used to make fresh bread, such as yeasts and cooking oil for use in order to make more breads. The profit will go toward the children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more yeast and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is from Balintawak, Aurora. To make a living, Cerila grows coconuts and bananas to sell, which she has been doing for five years. She earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

Cerila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Cerila joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers for growing coconuts and bananas.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and a father to one child. Mouhammad is the only provider for his family. 

Mouhammad owns a small shop for selling spare parts for specific cars. After gaining enough experience in this field from his father, he established his own business in 2006. He built a good experience in this field and has an excellent reputation in his area. 

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay the annual rent of his shop and to install a new rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay his shop's annual rent and install a rolling shutter.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una persona feliz, muy dedicada a su trabajo, responsable para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Guadalupe vive en la ciudad de Ibarra junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Guadalupe se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, negocio que inicio hace dos años atrás, al momento le está yendo muy bien ya que sus productos los está vendiendo en algunas tiendas de la ciudad de Ibarra.
Guadalupe solicita un crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra de tela algodón en cantidad mayores para la realización de sus prendas de vestir camisetas y confeccionar adornos para el hogar como manteles y limpiones para el hogar, inversión que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. 
Guadalupe sueña en tener un taller más grande que le permita contratar a más personal y convertirse en una empresa grande y distribuir al por mayor en todo el país y con estos ingresos darles la educación a sus hijos y enseñarles este bonito oficio para que sigan con la tradición.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is content, dedicated to her work, and responsible for improving her family's well being. She lives in the city of Ibarra with her husband and four children. She makes clothing, a business she started a few years ago that is prospering because she is selling to stores in Ibarra. 

Guadalupe is applying to FODEMI for a loan to buy wholesale cotton fabric to make clothing such as t shirts and household items such as tablecloths and towels so that she can increase her sales and earnings. She dreams of having a larger workshop so that she can hire staff, expand her business, and sell her merchandise at wholesale throughout the country. This income would allow her to educate her children and teach them a profession that they can continue.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing such as t shirts and household items such as tablecloths and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric and begin selling her clothing at local retailers.

loans.name: Saulegul

texts.en: Saulegul is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in their house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband Huanish works part-time in a local company. Her daughter Asemgul, age 18, studies at university and Erkebulan, age 15, Ahtuigan, age 13, and Axerkei, age 11, attend a local school. Saulegul has been running her own business of tailoring and handcraft for years. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory to run her business without pause because of lack of inventory. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run her business without pause because of lack of inventory

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 26 years old. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 8 and the youngest is 2. Her husband sells shoes. 

She has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy more clothes for sale such as skirts, shirts, and pants. The profit will assist in feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mernafe

texts.en: Mernafe is 37 years old. She is single with 1 child. She resides in Poblacion, Aurora. After 5 years of being in a service-based type of business activity, Mernafe earns a monthly income of 8,000. Mernafe has applied for a loan of 45,000 from GDMPC to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Mernafe hopes to expand her business and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev, 37, is married and lives with her family in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has three children, one of whom still depends on her income while the other two are already married and earning their own living. Khiev and her husband cooperate well in their business and are very passionate about supporting their family and providing a good education for their children. Khiev is engaged in growing seasonal rice crops whereas her husband provides threshing service with a machine that appears in the photo behind Khiev.

She is requesting a loan of 1,250 USD to buy a couple of cows for the maintenance of the rice field. The impact of the financing is that her farming business will be feasible and profitable because she will avoid unnecessary expenses on hiring other villagers’ animals to work on her farm. Her plan for the future is to continue growing her family-owned businesses every day to earn a good income, improve her shelter and provide her family with a comfortable living status.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque son un recurso importante en el negocio para mejorar y crecer económicamente, el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para las tortillas y para el pan, como maíz, leña, harina,levadura entre otros productos.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener más producción, esto se debió a la compra de productos para hacer el pan y las tortillas, con lo que realizo más ventas y genero mejores ganancias, en su familia se mantiene el número de miembros, pero ahora cuenta con más posibilidades para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María is applying for a new loan because it is an important element in improving her business and financial situation. She will use the loan to buy supplies such as corn, wood, flour, and yeast to make tortillas and bread. She was able to increase her production, sales, and earnings by using her previous loan to buy supplies to make bread and tortillas. Her family comprises the same number of people, though now she has more opportunities to improve their well being.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, flour, and yeast.

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en:
Sandagsuren is 60 years old and lives with his wife and his five sons in an apartment in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife, Uranchimeg, helps her husband to run their organic vegetable growing and sales business on their plot of land. His oldest son, Myagmardorj, age 24, has graduated university as an IT engineer. Odbayar, age 22, and Od-Orgil, age 20, are university students, and Gantulga, age 17, and Batbileg, age 16, are secondary school students. 

He has been running his organic vegetable growing and sales business since 1992. His wife and their sons help them during their summer vacation. 

His oldest son is now planning to start his own computer service business in town. Sandagsuren is now requesting 4,000,000,MNT to purchase starting inventory for his son's business. He and his family members are all hardworking and optimistic people.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his son's new computer service business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old, married and has four children. She is from Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Edna owns and operates a nipa-making business (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials). She has been in her business for seven years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Edna joined GDMPC. Edna is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is aged twenty eight and a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who both at school. He has been in farming for the past three years producing milk, horticultural and poultry products which he sells at the local market in his area. He also owns a motorbike for transportation business as an additional source of income.

He is requesting 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry which will give him more products to help him generate extra income to uplift his family's livelihood. He will use some of the money to pay school fees for his children, and he aspires to have redoubled his production in the next five years.

Poultry diseases and feeds are his major challenges in farming.

Edward is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for funding him with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Sheilla Mae

texts.en: For the past 8 years Shiella Mae, a 23-year-old married resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, has raised a variety of crabs to sell. Along with other irregular sources of income, she earns PHP 16,000 a month. Shiella Mae is requesting for a loan of PHP 40,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional crabs to raise. This year she expects to reap a good harvest and obtain a very favorable price for her crabs.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Bayarhuu, works in a local company. Her son, Temuujin, age 23, works with his father in the company and her younger son, Temuulen, age 13, goes to a local school. 

Altantsetseg has been running her butcher shop in the rental counter of the local market since 1994. She is popular due to her qualified products in town. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders to sell during holiday season. She is a hardworking, active and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Sivan

texts.en:
Sivan is a young Iraqi woman. She is 20 years old, married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sivan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Sivan has recently started working with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. Since 2010, she has been slowly building up her clientele. Using an old sewing machine, she enjoys creating custom-ordered dresses and other small fabric household items. To enhance her creativity options, she would like to buy an oversewing machine, which will allow her to offer a greater variety of choices for her customers. She also plans to buy some more quality fabrics and raw materials.

To be able to make the purchase, she took a loan in the amount of $1,400 USD from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.  

Sivan is under 30 and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy an oversewing machine, more fabrics and raw materials for sewing.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is married and has five children. She lives is Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, Irenia does planting, harvesting, and selling of bananas. She has been in this business for eight years. She has a monthly income of PHP 3,000. 

Irenia is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer. Irenia became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2011. Irenia aims that her business be more productive, so she can get a good return.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow and sell bananas.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and a father of four children. Habib is the only provider of the family. 

Habib owns small grocery store, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Habib is requesting a sum of $2,400 to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 40 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Myrna plants and harvests coconuts for sale. She has been in this business for 7 years. She earns Php 7,000 every month. Myrna is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase farm chemicals. In 2011, Myrna joined GDMPC. Myrna's future plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 12. Her husband is a technician. 

She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more food for her restaurant. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Juana Jeannette

texts.es:
Juana Jeannette de 38 años de edad, del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música, y en algunas ocasiones lee algunos libros de su interés personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recurso económico no pudo terminar sus estudios, ya que desde muy joven tiene que trabajar.
Gracias a sus espiritud y sus ganas de salir adelante, Juana de dedica a una pulpería, la cual consisten en vender productos de consumo diario y comestible del hogar, en cantidades pequeñas como: sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, aceite, jabón, arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, tiste. Negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina diaria de Juana es trabajar unas 14 horas diarias, desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinos de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano aumentar sus ingresos. Juana agradece la ayuda que lo inversionistas kiva le brindan, a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana Jeannette is 38 and lives in the department of León in western Nicaragua. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and read books that interest her. She did not complete her education and began working at a young age because she had limited resources. With enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead, Juana runs a store where she sells basic household products and foods such as coffee, shampoo, oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and cacao beans at retail. She sells merchandise to her neighbors 14 hours a day from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. 

The purpose of this loan is to provide capital to stock her store so that she can increase her income. Juana thanks the Kiva lenders for their support for low-income people in developing countries such as Nicaragua because it provides them with the means for decent work.

loans.use: to buy items such as coffee, shampoo, oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and cacao beans to stock her store.

loans.name: Providance

texts.en: Providance is 37 years old,  married, and has six children. Her husband is a builder. She sells shoes, which she has been doing for five years. Providance is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more shoes to sell. The profits will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Channoern's Group

texts.en:
Channoern is a 34-year-old, married mother who lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has five children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She is a housewife, while her husband provides for the family’s daily cost of living through work as a paid construction worker in the local area. Her husband has been in this business for ten years. The family's daily income is about US 6 per day.

This is the sixth loan for Channoern with VisionFund Cambodia. She fully paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her children’s education. 

Now she is leading her group (Channoern's Group) to ask for a loan of KHR 160,000 each. As the leader, Channoern is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to provide a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine.

loans.name: Uuganbaatar

texts.en:
Uuganbaatar is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a traditional yurt) in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife, Undraga, age 34, works in the local kindergarten as a nanny. His older son, Davaa, goes to the local school and his younger son, Angarag, goes to the local kindergarten.

Uuganbaatar has been providing transportation service to local customers since 1998. He transports hay and other forage during the warm season and charcoal and firewood during the cold season. 

His car has been broken for the last few months and his business has stopped because of that. He is now requesting 2,800,000 MNT to purchase a second-hand truck to enable him to provide his transportation service again in town. He is a hardworking, reliable and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase a used truck to provide his transportation service again.

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, el cría ganado lechero para fabricar productos derivados de la leche, como natilla, mantequilla, queso  y otros, estos productos los vende en el mercado local, su clientela a aumentado ya que se se ha extendido a otras comunidades, por eso está solicitando un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar dos vacas y aumentar la producción.
Con los ingresos obtenidos por esta actividad Oldemar sostiene la economía de su hogar y pretende crecer en clientela este año con la ayuda de Dios y el financiamiento que las empresas de  crédito comunal le proporciona.
texts.en: Oldemar farms and raises livestock. He tends milk cows and makes milk products such as custard, butter, and cheese to sell at the local market. His client base has increased as he has expanded distribution to other towns; therefore, he is applying for a loan of ¢1000000 colones to buy two cows to increase production. The income Oldemar earns from this business supports his household. This year he is trying to garner more customers with the help of God and the institutional funding provided to communal banks.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 31 years old. She is married with one child who is one year old. Her husband is a soldier. She has been in business for nine years. She wants a loan to buy more passion fruit, eggplants and yellow bananas for sale. The profit will assist her in finishing her house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi, 30, is a person who has worked her entire life with much dedication in order to get ahead. She is married, but yet to have children. 

Her main source of income is selling women’s, children’s, and men’s clothes, from place to place and also at home. She sells good quality clothes at good prices, so her customers keep increasing, day after day. Her major challenge is stiff competition from colleagues selling the same, but hard work and good relationships with her customers have helped expand her business territory. 

It is for this reason, to expand the business and add more stock of clothes, so as to cope well against the colleagues' competition, that Hamisi has approached Yehu Microfinance Trust with a loan request of KES 10,000.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business and buy more stock.

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en:
Afuwa  is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (father and brother). She has business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for 10 years. She generates additional income through selling piped water.  

Afuwa is requesting a loan from MCDT-SACCO forf 800,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and transportation.  She hopes to become a wholesaler, to buy a delivery van for transportation, and to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and her family.  They have no access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Zacharie

texts.en:
Zacharie is 34 years old. He is married and has two children. The oldest is 5 and the youngest is 1. His wife is a cleaner. 

He has been in business for 11 years. He wants a loan to buy cleaning materials for sale. The profit will go toward his savings.

loans.use: To buy more cleaning materials for sale.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 36 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 17. Her husband is a pastor. She has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to buy more pants, sweaters, and skirts for sale. The profits from the business will assist her in building a house.

loans.use: to buy more pants, sweaters and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is a 26-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has two young children, ages 5 and 1 year old.

She is engaged in  cooking snack foods like pancakes, fried banana and camote que (sweet potato) and selling them in neighboring towns. Her husband is a laborer who earns only a meager income that is not sufficient to meet the family's needs.

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil. In the future, Azucena would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for the education of her growing children.

loans.use: to  purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dorothy Joy

texts.en:
Dorothy Joy, age 27, is married and has three children. She lives in Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Dorothy Joy has been in her business of raising pigs/hogs for five years, and she gets an income of 10,500 PHP per month. 

Dorothy Joy became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeds.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is from Balintawak, Aurora. He is 55 years old. Felix is married and has 5 children. Felix raises coconuts. During harvests, he produces copra and sells it. The coconut shells are used in charcoal making. Felix has been in his business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Felix joined GDMPC. Felix is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase farm chemicals. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Dama Y Obrero Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Damas y Obrero” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; artesanía, transporte escolar, venta de miel, comida rápida, venta de ropa, productos de belleza, leña, bazar, peluquería, tejidos, confección de cortinas y manteles, costuras, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Maria Teresa, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un chaleco de color rojo, una chaqueta de color gris con franjas de color café claro, su pelo es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de kiosko, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a lunes desde las 9ºº horas hasta las 00ºº horas, tiene diarios, revistas, helado, dulces, bebidas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando como los diarios se los trae  una agencia directamente a su kiosko, las revistas las compra en el centro de Puerto Montt, y los helados, bebidas y confites en diferentes supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un porcentaje más de diarios, helados y confites.
Una de las metas de Maria Teresa es crecer y poder colocar otro local con otro rubro, así con esto generar mayores ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida. 
Maria Teresa vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 13 años e edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es darle lo mejor a su hijo en educación para que el dia de mañana tenga una profesión.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Ladies and Workers" and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different fields.  Among them are the following: Handicrafts, school transport, honey sales, fast food, clothing sales, beauty products, firewood, knick-knacks, hair-dressers, weaving, sewing drapes and tablecloths, sewing in general, and other services.  All of the members live in the city of Puerto Montt.  

Maria Teresa is one of the members of the Communal Bank.  In the photo she can be found standing in the first row in the first place looking from left to right, and dressed in a red colored vest and a grey jacket with brown clear fringes.  Her hair is dark brown and she wears it loose.  

She works in a kiosk and has been doing this for 9 years.  She comments that she works from Monday to Monday beginning at 9am and working until midnight.  She sells daily papers, magazines, ice cream, candies, and soft drinks.  

The products that she needs like the papers are brought directly to her kiosk by an agency.  The magazines she purchases in the market of Puerto Montt, along with the ice creams, drinks, and candies, which she buys at different supermarkets at a low cost.  That makes them convenient economically.  

With the loan she will buy one percent more of the newspapers, ice creams and candies.  

One of María Teresa's goals is to grow the business and be able to put up another kiosk in another zone, and in that way generate greater income in order to improve her quality of life. 

María Teresa lives together with her husband and a 13 year-old son.  Her dreams for the family are to give her son the best education so that in the future he will have a profession.  

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business.  With respect to the Communal Banking group that she forms a part of, she comments that in her group they have very good communication.  Also, the trainings have helped her learn new strategies for sales and accounting.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the region of The Lakes (Los Lagos).  Some of the attractions of Puerto Montt are the beautiful  green landscapes; It's beaches are very secluded; It is also known for its food, especially the fish and seafood, as well as for its handicrafts.  It is also the port of entry to the Island "Grande de Chiloé," which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy a percentage more of newspapers, ice creams and candies.

loans.name: Yanjindulam

texts.en: Yanjindulam, 31, lives with her husband and son in a ger in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Surhiisaihan, 32, provides transportation services in town. Her son, Enhtogoldor, 13, goes to a local school. The borrower graduated from hairstylist school in 2004 and started working in hair salon for years. She has obtained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now opening her own hair salon in a rented place and needs 5,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to begin it. She is a hardworking, honest and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start her own hair salon.

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia is from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old. She is widowed and has two children. 

Deogracia owns and operates a general store. She has engaged in her business for 15 years and earns PHP 6,000 per month. In 2008, Deogracia joined Kiva partner, Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

Deogracia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering of her general store.

loans.name: Jandra Maria

texts.es:
Jandra María de 28 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad de 8,2 años, originaria de la Paz Centro lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro de caracteriza por sus comidas típicas como el quesillo y del tiste que se sirven en jícara, una bebida típica de la región. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser una maestra titulada.
Gracias  a sus ganas de superación de personas, tiene por actividad una venta de ropa y calzado, cosméticos, negocio que está ubicado en su casa de habitación, desde hace 11 años que desempeña dicha actividad. La cual la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. La rutina de Jandra es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como: pantalones, cosméticos, blusas, short, faldas, vestidos, camisetas, ropa de cama,  pillamas, jugos de toallas ropa interior. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientelas, y en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos, Jandra María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a persona de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jandra María is a 28-year old woman, married and mother of two minor children, aged 8 and 2. She is from La Paz Centro, located on the west side of the country and known for its traditional food, such as the "quesillo" (tortilla wrapped around pickled onions and cheese sauce) and the "tiste" (traditional drink made of corn and cocoa), which is served in "jícara" (pot made from the fruit jícara). 

Although she would have liked to be a qualified teacher, unfortunately she didn't have the financial resources to study at university. Thanks to her motivation for self-improvement, she owns a business, located in her house, where she sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She has been working on this business for 11 years and enjoys her job very much, as it's been her way of life and that of her family. Jandra works 8 hours a day and offers products such as pants, cosmetics, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts, bed clothes, pajamas, towel sets and underwear. 

She plans to use the requested loan to invest in work capital and stock her business for the buying and selling of goods with an aim to keep her clients satisfied and to obtain more earnings in a not too distant future. Jandra María is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting people with limited financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and to stock her business for the buying and selling of goods, such as pants, cosmetics, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts, bed clothes, pajamas, towel sets and underwear.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
Flor de Campo es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 12 personas cada una de ellas con una actividad economica

María Blanca venta de abarrotes,
Alejandro venta de trastes de plástico,
Rosa venta de ropa,
Juana B. farmacia,
Tomasa venta de abarrotes,
Esteban venta de pan ,
Aurora venta de zapatos,
Paula jardineria,
Marisol venta de pan, 
Pedro Albañileria,
Juana J. carpinteria
Grisel venta de ropa.

Este grupo está ubicado en una comunidad donde las principales actividades económicas son el corte de la naranja y la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar. 

Esteban es otro de los integrantes del grupo Flor de Campo. El esta casado con Maria del Carmen y tiene un pequeño hijo.

Don Esteban platica que hace mas de 3 años decidió poner una panadería en su hogar ya que sabia este oficio y creando su propio negocio tendría la oportunidad de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
El dice que su actividad inicia desde el medio día preparando la harina e ingredientes para hacer la masa del pan lo cual le toma tiempo cuando la masa esta lista inicia a hacer las figuras de los diferentes panes para posteriormente  meterlo al horno. Todo el proceso le toma la tarde justo a tiempo para tomar su canastas y salir a venderlo de casa en casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar mas insumos como son leña, harina, levadura, para la elaboración de su pan.
A futuro le gustaría poder contratar un par de vendedores para sus ganancias aumente y mas gente pruebe su pan.
Este grupo esta agradece a VisionFund por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Flor de Campo is the name of the communal bank that comprises the following 12 members who have different businesses: María Blanca sells groceries: Alejandro sells plastic recyclables; Rosa sells clothing; Juana B. runs a pharmacy; Tomasa sells groceries; Esteban sells bread; Aurora sells shoes; Paula sells plants; Marisol sells bread; Pedro is a bricklayer; Juana J. is a carpenter; and Grisel sells clothing. The bank is located in a community where the main business activities are growing oranges and sugar cane.

Esteban belongs to Flor de Campo, is married to Maria del Carmen, and has a young son. Three years ago, he set up a bakery in his house because he knew the profession and believed that having his own business would give him the chance to give his family a better life. At noon, he starts preparing the flour and other ingredients to make the bread dough. This allows the dough time to rise before he shapes it in different forms and puts it in the oven to bake. The process takes all afternoon and is finished in time for him to fill his baskets and go door-to-door selling the bread with friends and neighbors.

A loan from VisionFund will help him buy more supplies such as wood, flour, yeast, and sugar to make bread. He would like to hire two salespeople some day so that he can increase earnings and more people can sample his bread. The communal bank thanks VisionFund for its support.

loans.use: to buy wood, flour, yeast, and sugar.

loans.name: Qodirbi

texts.ru:
Кодирби жительница города Вахдат. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Кодирби дружелюбная и очень хорошая женщина. Она человек с сильным характером, которая смогла заняться своим делом и открыть собственный магазин за короткое время.
Вот уже два года Кодирби занимается торговлей. Он открыла небольшой продуктовый магазин в городе. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот ей необходима финансовая поддержка. Кодирби берет кредит для покупки хлебобулочных изделий, конфет, сахара, колбасных изделий, а также для покупки приправ и сухофруктов. Кодирби не хочет терять клиентов из-за небольшого ассортимента продуктов.
texts.en:
Qodirbi is a resident of the city of Vahdat. She is 50 years old and married. She has three children. Qodirbi is a friendly and very good woman. She is a person with a strong character, which has helped her do her business and open her own store in a short time. Qodirbi has been doing sales here for two years already. She opened a small grocery store in the city. 

In order to increase the turnover she needs financial support. Qodirbi takes a loan for the purchase of baked goods, candy, sugar and meat products, as well as to buy spices and dried fruits. Qodirbi does not want to lose customers due to a small assortment of products.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, candy, sugar and meat products, as well as spices and dried fruits

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 36-year-old farmer in Kisii county, in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and three children. Only one child has started schooling. Charles has been in farming for over five years, producing milk, maize, beans, bananas, and tea which he sells at the local market in his area. He is employed as an additional source of income.

Charles is requesting a KES 31,200 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will give him more produce and earn him extra income that will uplift his family's livelihood. He will use some of the money to pay school fees for his children. 

Charles aspires to have two more dairy cows in the next five years. Poor climatic changes and lack of adequate capital are his major challenges in farming. Charles is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support it is giving to its clients.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow for his farm.

loans.name: Hamrokhon

texts.ru:
Хамрохон житель города Вахдат. Он 28 - летний женатый молодой человек. Хамрохон живет с женой. Вместе с ними живут его родители. Жена Хамрохона домохозяйка. 
Хамрохон работает таксистом. Он предоставляет услугу по маршруту Вахдат - Душанбе. В этой области Хамрохон три года. Он берет кредит для приобретения нового автомобиля. Хамрохон хочет продать свою машину и купить новый недорогой автомобиль, что продолжить работу.
texts.en:
Hamrokhon is a resident of the city of Vahdat. He is a 28-year old, married young man. Hamrokhon lives with his wife. His parents live together with them. Hamrokhon's wife is a housewife. 

Hamrokhon works as a taxi driver. He provides his service on the route Vahdat - Dushanbe. Hamrokhon has been in this area for three years. He takes a loan for the purchase of a new car. Hamrokhon would like to sell his car and buy a new, low-priced car to continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase a new car, in order to continue his work

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам берет повторный кредит в Хумо. Он целеустремленный человек, который профессионал своего дела. Рустам размещает животноводство и строительные работы. Он занимается строительными работами по найму в районе Султонобод. 
Рустам хочет увеличить поголовья крупнорогатого скота. Поэтому он берет кредит.
texts.en:
Rustam takes his second loan with MLO Humo. He is a purposeful man, who is professional in his work. Rustam has livestock and does construction work. He is engaged in construction work for hire in the Sultonobod region.

Rustam would like to increase the number of cattle, and therefore takes a loan.

loans.use: to purchase calves and a bull

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru:
Исмоил житель Яванского района. Ему 35 лет. У него большая семья. Он женат, имеет шестерых детей. В семье он единственный кормилец. 
Исмоил уже 4 года как арендует магазин, где занимается куплей-продажей продуктов питания. Для того чтобы как-то улучшить условия жизни в семье и увеличить товарооборот в магазине он берет кредит.
texts.en:
Ismoil is a resident of the Yavan region. He is 35 years old, and has a large family. He is married and has six children. He is the only provider in the family. 

Ismoil has been renting a store for four years already, where he sells food products. He takes a loan in order to somewhat improve the family's living conditions and increase the store's turnover.

loans.use: to purchase food products to increase his assortment

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. Her previous loan was a big help to her food stall. It also helped her in her everyday expenses and in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide income for their family.

Editha would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha dreams to have other businesses and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her food stall business.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
Doña Ángela es otro de los integrantes del grupo Las Palomas, ella cuanta con 51 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casadada con el señor Jorge con el cual tiene 2 hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria.

Doña Ángela platica que ella decidió iniciara a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que cada dia la situacion economica esta peor el dinero no rinde y quiere brindar a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida. Doña Ángela desde hace un poco mas de 5 años realiza ventas de zapatos por catalogo con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, ella hace sus ventas saliendo por la tardes a mostrar sus catalogos a sus clientes para levantar pedidos los cuales surte posteriormente y entregra. 

Ella dice que hay temporadas cuando se vende mas que son en meses de desfiles o fiestas ya que la gente quiere estrenar, Lo que mas le gusta de sus actividad es que la realiza en su tiempo libre y no descuida sus labores del hogar.

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de Zapatos para continuar realizando sus ventas. 

Ella quiere a futuro poder tener su negocio fijo en su hogar para no tener que caminar tanto y poder dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de ir a la universidad.

los demas integrantes de este grupo son :

Perfecta venta de pollo
José Luis venta de bisuteria
Heidi venta de topper(articulos para el hogar)
Deysi venta de topper(articulos para el hogar)
Guadalupe venta de ropa 
Consepcion venta de ropa
texts.en:
Ángela belongs to the communal bank Las Palomas. She is 51 and only finished elementary school. She is married to Jorge, and their two children attend elementary school. Ángela started her own business because her financial situation was worsening, she had little money, and she wished to provide her children with better circumstances. Five years ago, she began selling shoes through catalogs to her friends and neighbors. She goes out in the afternoon to show her customers catalog merchandise and take orders for later delivery.

The best selling seasons occur during parades and holidays, since the customers like to show off then. She likes that this business lets her work in her free time and also do her housework. She will use the loan to buy shoes to continue making sales. She would like to set up a store in her house one day so that she doesn't have to sell door-to-door. She also wants to give her children the chance to go to college.

The other members and their businesses are: Perfecta sells chicken; José Luis sells costume jewelry; Heidi sells household items; Deysi sells household items; Guadalupe sells clothing; Consepcion sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina, de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Doña Faustina lleva aproximadamente 15 años de dedicarse al comercio. Ella vende de manera ambulante variedad de mercadería como cortinas, camera o ropa de cama, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y sandalias, mediante pedidos. También los clientes llegan a buscarle producto a su casa. Para este negocio ha invertido ya varios prestamos de ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es el 14 ciclo y es por 12,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar mas ropa y sandalias para la venta. Quiere mantener productos en inventario para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos. Su meta es hacer más clientes para seguir adelante con el negocio y aportar económicamente al núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Faustina, age 48, is married and has two children.  She lives in a village in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Faustina has been a merchant for approximately 15 years.  She sells a variety of merchandise like curtains, bedding, clothing for women, men, and children, and sandals.  She sells by order in an itinerant manner.  She also has customers who come to her house seeking her products.

She has already invested several loans from ODEF in her business.  This is her 14th cycle, and the loan of for 12,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy more clothes and sandals to sell.  She wants to keep products in inventory in order to increase sales and income.  Her goal is to get more customers in order to get ahead with the business and to contribute financially to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru:
Наимджону 24 года. Еще не женат, живет вместе с родителями в Шахритусском районе. У него высшее экономическое образование, но он не работает по профессии. 
Вот уже 3 года как Наимджон занимается животноводством, а в свободное время он помогает брату, у которого есть собственная столовая. У Наимджона имеются все необходимые условия для разведения скота. Наимджон берет кредит для закупа коров, телят и быка. За счет полученной прибыли он хочет сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Naimjon is 24 years old. He has not married yet, and lives together with his parents in the Shahrituz region. He has higher economical education, but he does not work in this area. 

Naimjon has been engaged in livestock breeding for three years already, and in his spare time he helps his brother, who has his own cafeteria. All the necessary conditions for livestock breeding are present at Naimjon's. Naimjon takes a loan for the purchase of cows, calves and bulls. He would like to repair his home based on the income received.

loans.use: to purchase a cows, calves and bulls

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a 28-year-old married man with a child living in Masindi, Uganda.He is a policeman and has been in service for five years .He was inspired into service by his love for peace and order despite the fact that it comes with a low salary that can hardly support his family. In order to increase his income he decided to venture into the produce business which has turned out to be very lucrative.

Morris intends to use the loan to buy produce like maize and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce like maize and millet to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.ru:
Кристине родилась и живет в городе Капан,Сюникской области вместе с родителями пенсионерами. Кристине 40 лет  и она не замужем. Она окончила Капанский Политехнический институт и по профессии инженер металлург.  
Кристина проработала по своей специальности 6 лет но так как зарплата была небольшой она решила открыть свой собственный бизнес. 
С 2010 года Кристине открыла свою собственную кафетерию в Капане. Бизнес небольшой ,но как сказала Кристине:” прибыльный и хватает на жизнь”. В бизнесе ей помогают родители и друзья. У Кристине уже есть множество постоянных клиентов которые любят сидеть и проводить приятное время в кафе у Кристине. Она любит свой бизнес и гордиться теми достижениями, которых она достигла за такой маленький срок. 
Кристине решила расширить меню и добавить традиционных блюд; лагмаджо,шаурма и кебаб , что поможет ей разширить оборот бизнеса.
Кристине нужен кредит на сумму 1700$ для покупки печи для лагмаджо и обновить посуду в кафе.
texts.en:
Kristine was born and lives in the city of Kapan, in the Syunik region together with her parents, who are retired. Kristine is 40 years old and she is not married. She finished the Kapan Polytechnic Institute and is a metallurgical engineer by profession. Kristine worked in this area for six years, but as the salary was small she decided to start her own business. 

In 2010, Kristine opened her own cafeteria in Kapan. The business is small, but as Kristine says: "It is profitable and enough for living". Her parents and friends help her in the business. Kristine has many loyal customers who love to sit and have a good time at Kristine's cafe. She loves her business and is proud of the accomplishments she has made in such a short period of time. 

Kristine decided to broaden the menu and add traditional dishes; lahmajo, shawarma and kebab, which will help her increase the turnover of the business. Kristine needs a loan in the amount of 1,700 US dollars to purchase an oven for lahmajo and add tableware to the cafe.

loans.use: To buy a new oven for making "'lahmajo'' and to add tableware to the cafe

loans.name: Kulsun

texts.ru: Кулсун 54 года, замужем, С ними проживает младшая дочка Ажар. В качестве основного дохода с 1996 года Кулсунай занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кулсун, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 голов КРС, 15 голов МРС и 2 лошади.По мимио этого  Кулсун обрабатывает 5,13 га земли где ежегодно сажает картофель, зерновые культуры и многолетние,   прибыль от швейного бизнеса составляет 7,500 KGS в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулсун обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) скота, что позволит увеличить сбор молока. Доходы от кредита Кулсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.  В будущем планирует сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Kulsun is 54 years old and married. Her youngest daughter Azhar lives with them. In search of a source of income, Kulsun has been engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1996. Thanks to Kulsun's persistent work, her farm currently has three heads of cattle, 15 sheep and goats and two horses. In addition to this, Kulsun processes 5.13 hectares of land where she plants potatoes and crops every year. The income from the business is 7,500 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulsun turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle, which will increase the collection of milk. Kulsun plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business. She plans to repair her house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
This is Lerma. Her previous loan was a big help in her dressmaking business. She was able to make more dresses as she expanded her business through the loan. It also helped a lot in her family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her dress making business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lerma dreams of having a big stall for her business and hopes to help her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa is single and has three children. She has received no formal education. Adjowa sells smoked fish and cassava in Kufur near Elmina and has done so for 20 years. She uses her income to support herself and her children. 

Adjowa will use the loan to purchase more fish and cassava for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjowa plans to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is aged twenty-six and a farmer in Kisii in Kenya where he lives with his wife and one child who is schooling. He has been in farming for the past ten years producing maize, potatoes, beans and bananas which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will give him more milk produce and earn him extra income which will boost his family's income and help him to also pay for his child's schooling. He aspires to have three high-quality dairy cows in the next five years.

Poor markets, inadequate capital, and poor road networks are his major challenges in farming.

He is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for its continuous support to its clients.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is married and lives in Cortes, Bohol. She is 59 years old and the mother of three grown children. She earns a living by selling snack foods like banana chips, rice cakes, pastries and camote (or sweet potatos). She has been in the food-vending business for 20 years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000 to buy more ingredients, including flour, cooking oil and sugar, so that she can continue to serve her customers at a nearby school. Susana does not rely on her children for support and is working hard to earn a living and prepare for old age. In the future, her goal is to invest to other business in order to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for a food-vending business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a small village of Gardabani district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and sell milk. Besides, David has a horse. He brings wood from the forest using the horse and sells the wood locally. 

David is a very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle and to repair the shed. After purchasing the feed, the cattle will be fattening properly. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. David awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle and repair the shed

loans.name: Khujamiyor

texts.ru:
Хужамиёр - житель Шахритусского района. Ему 22 года. Живет он с родителями. Его родители работают в дехканском хозяйстве. 
Хужамиёр с 17 лет занимается животноводством, в течение 5 лет он хорошо усвоил этот вид деятельности. Хужамиёр просит кредит для закупа нескольких голов крупнорогатого скота. Он собирается закупить скот в дальнейшем для продажи. За счет полученной прибыли Хужамиёр планирует расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Khujamiyor is a resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 22 years old and lives with his parents. His parents work at a dekhan farm. Khujamiyor has been engaged in livestock breeding since he was 17 years old, and in this 5-year period he has learned the business well. 

Khujamiyor requests a loan for the purchase of cattle. He has decided to purchase livestock to sell in the future. Khujamiyor plans to expand his business based on the income received.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and gobies

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es: Betzabe, de 47 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus hijas: Lucia y Betsy a las que cuida en la casa que compró hace 17 años.  Se dedica a los tejidos desde hace mas de 7 años,  trabaja en la comodidad de su casa y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su madre  para realizar estos trabajos que por lo general es  mediante pedidos que le hacen su clientela, en cada mes que trabaja logra tener ingresos de las cuales e ha asegurado de que sean estables en cada mes por lo que  siempre trabaja de manera ordenada y buscando la tendencia de moda en colores para que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el producto. Para mas adelante desea aumentar la cantidad  producida y aprender nuevos puntos de tejido. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo obtenido, pues de esa manera se siente tranquila de invertir, además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que en su asociación le enseñaron a ser responsable. Betzabe, invertirá el dinero a la compra de lanas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Betzabe, age 47, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her daughters, Lucia and Betsy, and cares for them in the house that she bought 17 years ago. Betzabe has been knitting for more than seven years. She works comfortably out of her house and on a few occasions she will receive help from her mother so that she can complete the work. Betzabe generally receives orders that have been placed by her customers. The work she completes each month generates income that assures her that she will have stability. For this reason, she works in an organized manner and is always looking for trendy colors for her products that will satisfy her customers.

Going forward, Betzabe would like to increase her production and learn new knitting skills. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is appreciative of the support she has obtained. The loan will allow her to invest with peace of mind. She also promises to be punctual with her payments since her Communal Bank has taught her how to be responsible. Betzabe will invest the money in the purchase of wool in bulk.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan, aged 50, has been with HKL for five loans already and this loan will be her second time with Kiva organization. Kan has made a good repayment and she has become a VIP client for her honesty with HKL institute. After successfully paying her previous loan, Kan is resubmitting her request in order to obtain another financial support from lenders. She is hoping to have this loan amount so that she will be able to buy more stock of rice to keep nourishing her family as daily food through the year. The rice will cost 1,000 USD. 

With the remaining amount of 500 USD, Kan will reinvest in her recycling business, buying and selling recycled materials, an activity she and her husband have been in for over 10 years after their farming business. The impact she expects with the financing is that her sales will increase and thereby boost her income. Through her determination despite hardships, she hopes to gradually improve her business and help providing a better education to all of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to keep nourishing her family and to reinvest in her recycling business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amelita dreams that her store will be bigger and hopes to have a simple and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio esta casado, tiene 61 años de edad, no tuvo   tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando,  se dedica a prestar su servicios de albañilería, construcción y remodelación de casa, inicio este trabajo con sus padres, hasta el momento lleva 35 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficio domésticos de casa.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de herramientas, como paleta, martillo, cortadora eléctrica, tenaza, planchas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener mas trabajadores a su cargo.
texts.en: Eleuterio, 61, is married.  He never had the opportunity of attending school.  He has six children three of which are in school.  He works providing bricklaying services, in construction and remodeling houses.  He started this work with his parents and to date has 35 years’ experience in this line of work.  He has his wife’s support; she works doing domestic chores.  He’s asking for a loan that he’ll use to buy tools like trowels, hammers, electric saws, pliers, plate compactors, etc.  In future, he hopes to hire more employees.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
Doña Mercy es una mujer emprendedora que a base de trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado construir sus sueños, Doña Mercy se define como una persona humilde, soñadora, solidaria y muy trabajadora, Mercy tiene 41 años, ella es viuda y tiene 2 hijos con los cuales vive y son su adoración y razón de vivir, el negocio que ella tiene en una ferretería que inicio hace más 15 años en la ciudad de Ambato.
El crédito que la señora Mercy solicita a FODEMI es para seguir incrementando mercadería en la ferretería que tiene, la cual ha ido creciendo y se ha ido ganando mayor número de clientes los, y la inversión ayudara a Mercy a satisfacer la demanda existente en estos momentos.
El sueño que Mercy tiene es seguir trabajando en su ferretería y lograr tener otras sucursales para que trabajen sus familiares y darles con estos ingresos una buena educación universitaria a sus hijos, con la esperanza de que la ferretería la administren sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercy’s an enterprising woman who by means of work and effort has succeeded in building her dreams.  She defines herself as a humble, supportive, very hardworking woman who has dreams.  Mercy’s 41-years-old and a widow; she has two children she lives with and who she adores and her reason for living.  The business she has is a hardware store she started more than 15 years ago in the city of Ambato.

The loan Mercy’s asking FODEMI for is to continue adding stock merchandise to her hardware store which has been growing and has acquired a larger number of customers.  This investment will help Mercy meet current demand.

Mercy’s dream is to continue working in her hardware store and to eventually open branches for her family members to run and with income earned be able to provide her children with university education.  She hopes her children will manage the hardware store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 45 years old from a small village of Gardabani district. She has a large family: husband, two children and parents-in-law. Her husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income and her parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, they have 50 hens. Gulnaz sells eggs and cheese locally in an open market at a good price. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Gulnaz requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle. After purchasing the feed, the cattle will be fattening properly and this will increase the cheese production and thus sales. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Gulnaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fátima, es soltera no tiene hijos, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco   de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente atiende el Internet de su hermana mayor, además es socia con su hermana ya que venden productos por catálogos.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar cosméticos y productos de belleza y formar parte de la empresa de cosméticos pero esta vez como promotora independiente, así sus ingresos aumentaran.

El sueño  de Fátima es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer  una variedad de cosméticos y joyas.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Fátima’ single and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Río Seco zone.  She attended secondary school and currently manages her older sister’s Internet access service; she’s also a partner with her sister selling cosmetics via catalog.  The loan she needs is to buy cosmetics and beauty products to become part of the cosmetics firm as an independent consultant; her income will increase this way.  Fátima’s dream is to have a store where she can sell a variety of cosmetics and jewelry.  This is the first time she’s asked for credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mselemani

texts.en:
Mselemani is forty-five years old and lives with her six children. All of the children are still in school and she is a widowed, hardworking lady. She makes her living selling clothing specifically for ladies -- shirts, pants, dresses and skirts, among others. She has had this business for several years, and this has given her a lot of experience that allows her to maximize her earnings. 

The business is located in her house, and she also sells on the street. She is well known by people in the area. She has acquired a large clientele because everyone knows that everything she sells is of quality, at accessible prices, with incomparable service and within reach of her customers.

She is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and very determined. Day after day, she works her hardest to earn a better living and ensure successes for the future. In recent weeks, demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment. However, she doesn't have enough capital to back her up, which is why she is applying to Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy wholesale clothes. She has good payment references and an impeccable ethic.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothes.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a young entrepreneur from the town of Msambweni. She runs a hairdressing salon. She started her business three years ago and during this period has attracted a large number of clients due to the quality of her services.

Mwanaidi needs to add new beauty products to her salon in order to serve all her clients. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase a dryer, hair relaxers, shampoo, creams, etc. This loan will allow Mwanaidi to increase her income and develop the business further.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer, hair relaxers, shampoo, creams, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16 de julio   de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente cursa el primer año de contabilidad, en el turno de la noche y trabaja como tejedora en un taller de la urbe alteña ( o sea en la ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una computadora e impresora para realizar los trabajos prácticos, del instituto donde asiste y estudia contabilidad.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Gladys is single and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio zone.  She completed secondary education and is currently in the first year of Accounting in night school; she also works as a knitter in a workshop in the city of El Alto.  She needs the loan to buy a computer and a printer to do her assignments for the accounting courses she’s taking at an institute she attends.  This is the first time she’s requested credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer for her accounting courses.

loans.name: Josefinas Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma Elena tiene la edad de 43 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casado con el señor Rolando que se dedica al trabajo del Operador de autobuces, ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados y los otros dos pequeños estudian. Ella platica que hace más de 12 años inició su actividad con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo inicio a vender ropa para dama y caballero casa por casa con su amiga y vecinos de su comunidad poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo e inicio a salir a vender a otras comunidades como san Agustin, Tetela y Cosolapa. Ella a hecho cada dia mas clientes y hace algunos años inicia a vender tambien un poco de bisuteria (accesorios para dama) y dice que Gracias a Dios se ha vendido muy bien. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, camisas, shorts, ropa interior, pantalones, calcetines, pulceras, aretes y bolsas de mano para posterior venta. Ella espera que cada dia su negocio cresca mas ya que desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y en un futuro poco a poco construir un pequeño local en el cual vender sus productos.
