John cleared his previous loan successfully and now he has borrowed a fourth loan KES 100,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to improve his dairy farm by purchasing two heifers and food for his cows.  

The profits he earns will be used to plough back into his dairy farm and pay school fees. His dream is live a positive life and prosper in his dairy farming business.

loans.use: buy two heifers and dairy fodder

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be a determined and jovial woman. 

Isabella operates a retail business where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a viable business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to build a coop. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Additionally, Isabella does farming which increases her business income.

loans.use: to build a coop

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
Rahma, who is in her early 30's, is married with two children who are still going to school. Rahma has had a beauty salon business for three years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rahma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Rahma will share this loan with her loan group "White" with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 55 years old, married, and has five children. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk, which she has been doing  for 10 years. Her business is located in a an agricultural area and her primary customers are local residents. She also sells clothes to earn additional income. 

Rosemary is requesting her first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy a dairy cow.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of cow feed during the dry season. Her goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 50-year-old, married woman. She has ten children with ages ranging from 21 years to 30 years. She describes herself as being honest. 

Lucy operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Lucy will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to be a cereal wholesale seller within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). She also does farming, which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Dúo El Cafecito Group

texts.es:
Dúo el cafecito
Este dúo está conformado por el señor Juan, tiene 56 años de edad y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y es papa soltero, y se dedica al servicio de diferentes tipos de banquetes en su restaurante llamado CAFÉ-MI CAFECITO ubicado en Magdalena Milpas Altas, el está solicitando el crédito para la inversión  de compra de abarrotes y carnes para su restaurante ya que su propósito es seguir creciendo en su negocio con la ayuda de sus hija y su hijo, y su mayor deseo es que sus dos hijos continúen con su carrera de diversificado,Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestilbes para la elavoracion de comida para la venta.
texts.en:
The group's name is 'Dúo el Cafecito.' A member of this duo consists of Juan, who is 56 years old and has two dependent children.  He is a single dad and he provides a service of different types of banquets at his restaurant called 'Cafe-Mi Cafecito,' located in Magdalena Milpas Altas.  He is requesting a loan to invest in buying groceries and meat for his restaurant because his purpose is to grow his business with the help of his daughter and son.

His greatest wish is that his two children continue their diversified careers.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of products to prepare food to sell.

loans.use: To purchase food products to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Pauline Labelle

texts.fr: Pauline est une femme de 23 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un coin de la ville depuis 3 ans. Grâce à sa determination et à son dynamisme, elle a su fidéliser une bonne partie de son voisnage et augmenter graduellement cette clientèle au point où elle ressent le besoin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des produits de beauté (huile de cheveux, défrisant, etc) afin satisfaire sa clientèle et ses prévisions de résultat. les bénéfices seront réintroduits dans son activité d'une part et subviendront aux besoins familiaux (éducation, nutrition, logement) d'autre part.
texts.en: Pauline, a woman of 23 years old, is single and has no children. She has owned and operated a beauty salon in a downtown location for three years. Thanks to her determination and dynamic spirit, she has managed to turn a lot of her neighbors into faithful clients and has gradually grown this clientele to the point where she feels a need to grow her stock of merchandise. She would like to use this loan to buy beauty products (hair oil, straightener, etc.) so as to satisfy her customers and her own expectations for her results. Part of the profit will be ploughed back into the business and part used to cover her family needs (education, nutrition, rent).

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Jean Martial

texts.fr: jean Martial est un homme célibataire de 21 ans sans enfant, mais il a à sa charge sa soeur cadette. Il est commercant dans un amrché de la capitale depuis 1 an où il a ouvert une petite boutique de vêtements. Son activté fonctionne bien mais il est obligé à cause de la petitesse de son capital d'aller au déballage chaque week end pour avoir de quoi vendre. C'est pour celà qu'il sollicte ce crédit qui lui permettra de s'acheter un ballot de pull-over et des manequins pour exposition. Ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi ses bénéfices. bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvestis dans san activté pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir à ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa soeur cadette.
texts.en: Jean Martial is a single man of 21 with no children, though he is raising his younger sister. For one year, he has been a merchant in a market in the capital where he has opened a little clothing boutique. His business is going well, but because his working capital is so meager,.he has been obliged every weekend to go to where shipments are unpacked, hunting for something to sell. That is why he has requested this loan to permit him to buy a bale of pullovers and some mannequins to display them on. This will not only increase his sales but also his profit, which will be partly reinvested to grow his business and partly used to help him cover his needs and the needs of his little sister.

loans.use: to buy a bale of pullovers and some display mannequins.

loans.name: Rosa Diana

texts.es:
Rosa  vive en el cantón libertad  Tiene 30 años. Es casada  tiene  dos hijos menores. Ella  Tomo la decisión de buscar trabajo para  salir adelante con su familia  y  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa.  Decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio  de venta de prenda de vestir. En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientes necesarios.  

Rosa  trabaja en su negocio  diariamente. Con el préstamo  el comprara camisas, ropa, blusa, pantalones, varios, etc. su meta es poder  mejorar sus ingresos  tener  mayor clientela  para poderle brindar mejor servicio y tener local propio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 30, lives in the Libertad canton.  She is married and has two minor children.  She made the decision to look for work in order to get her family ahead.  As no one gave her the opportunity to work for a company, she decided to get money together to start her business of selling clothes.  Her business has now grown, little by little, and she has come to have the customers she needs.  Rosa works in her business every day.  

She will use the loan to buy shirts, blouses, pants, and various items of clothing, etc.  Her goal is to be able to improve her income and to have more customers.  She wants to do this in order to be able to provide better service and to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité se dedican a variadas actividades con las cuales ayudan a sus familias y quieren salir adelante. La  mayoría son madres de familia y  cabezas de hogar por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante. Este grupo está en su cuarto ciclo.
Una de las miembros es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la manicura, es una persona muy creativa, que muestra toda su creatividad en cada trabajo y eso hace que tenga una mejor clientela. Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando y el día de mañana tener un salón y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, quita esmaltes, algodones, limas, corta cutículas, etc.
texts.en:
The members of this committee engage in different business activities so that they can help their families and move forward. Most of them are mothers and heads of household, so each day they must make many sacrifices in order to get ahead. This group is in its fourth loan cycle.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, who is a manicurist. She is a very creative person who demonstrates her imagination through her work. For this reason, she has a good clientele. Her dream is to continue working so that she can have a salon one day. She also hopes to continue helping her family.

Maria is requesting a loan to invest in nail polishes, nail polish remover, cotton, files, nail clippers, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes, nail polish remover, cotton, files, nail clippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr: Monsieur Djibril est un agriculteur depuis plus de 25 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il adore son métier car il vit de cela avec sa famille. Djibril commence sa journée à 8h et la finie à 19h le soir. Il demande un crédit de 100000F CFA pour acheter de l’engrais et du fumier. Il désire collaborer longtemps avec l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir augmenter son pouvoir d’achat.
texts.en:
Monsieur Djibril has been a farmer for more than 25 years. He is married and the father of a family. He adores farming because that is what he and his family live on. 

 Djibril begins his day at 8 a,m. and stops work at 7 in the evening. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 F CFA to buy fertilizer and manure. He would like to be able to collaborate with IMCEC for a long time so as to improve his purchasing power.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for his fields.

loans.name: Nazemse Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA  est responsable du groupe  NAZEMSE. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 05 ans et le moins âgés à 02 ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des habits depuis 02ans.  Elle s’approvisionne aux  marchés  de  secteur 10 et au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  10 complets pour enfants, 08 complets de pagnes et ensembles pour grande personnes.	
Elle  veut réinvestir  ses bénéfices  dans son activité. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme FATIMATA  is the leader of this group called NAZEMSE. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is five and the youngest is two years old. The first child goes to school, and Mme Fatimata is responsible for two other people. 

Mme Fatimata has been selling clothing for two years. She gets her wares at markets in Sector 10 and the Grand Marche. Her clients are men and women. 

She wants to buy 10 outfits for children, 8 lengths (3 meters each) of African cloth, and outfits for adults. She intends to reinvest her profit in her business. Her ambition is to grow her business and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 outfits for children, 8 lengths of African cloth, and outfits for adults.

loans.name: Kazim

texts.en:
Kazim is a 58-year-old married man with four children. He is a farmer and has been raising wheat and corn for the last eight years, since he is on a pension. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. Raising wheat and corn takes a lot of effort and water. 

These products are very expensive. People use fresh wheat for making flour, and corn as a fresh and very healthy vegetable. Azerbaijani people boil it for hours and eat it with salt.

Kazim sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 300 AZN. His son actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Kazim wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools and special organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and special organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys says that since she received her previous loan, she has been able to increase her income. In fact she tells us that she was able to buy a dairy cow and she now sells milk. Gladys wants to clear some school fees arrears for her son which is why she is asking for this loan. She is grateful for the support she is getting from Kiva lenders. She is well-known in her area for being a reliable brick supplier. In future, she wants to build a residential house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 36 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in Voi and makes a living by selling flat breads. She makes her flat breads from her home, in the kitchen, and later sells them door-to-door. She says that as this way of selling is cumbersome, she wants to establish a small stall where she can sell from. 

She is asking for the loan to buy all the materials she needs for making the stand. She estimates that this loan will help her a lot because she will be able to increase her sales by having a place from which to sell to her customers. Her future plans are to increase the volume of her production, and by making and selling additional products like dumplings and other fast foods. Her immediate goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy the construction materials she needs for making her food stand.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes acre of additional family members (her sisters).  She has a business selling tomatoes and has been in this business for four years, selling to all categories of people, retail. She generates additional income through selling clusters of bananas. She works at the market seven days a week.

Rose has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality   and   perishabilty. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to start growing tomatoes herself.   She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity but has access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Baxsheish

texts.en: Baxsheish is married and has 2 children. He was an IDP (internally displaced person) from Agdam City, but now lives in the Absheron region with his family. Baxsheish is 34 years old. He has had a cafe business for 5 years. He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to expand his cafe. He needs to improve his business in order to cater to more clients.

loans.use: to expand his cafe.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira is  an IDP (internally displaced person) from Kalbadjar region,  who now lives in the Absheron region with her family. She is married and has two daughters. Elmira is 49 years old. She has been working as a teacher for 11 years. She needs a loan of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a computer for her work. Elmira thinks she must to do innovation in her work.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 24 years old, from Nakuru, and is a single man supporting his mother.

Stephen has a grocery business that he has been running for the past two years. He has applied for his first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him to buy more stocks of onions, tomatoes, vegetables, etc. to add to his stock and sell. He hopes to be in a position to open up a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, vegetables, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 23 years old and married with three children. Her previous business has grown and this prompted her to start a new business of selling new clothes. It is now six months old and generates a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Daisy is servicing her third loan, this time of 40,000 KES, from KADET Ltd and intends to use this amount to purchase new clothing for sale.  

The profits she gets will be put back into her business and also for her family's upkeep. Her hope in life is to see her business expand.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing materials

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 35 years old and has a bakery business in Ndunyu Njeru town where he sells and distributes bread. He has been in the business for three years and it has been profitable.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of wheat flour and sugar for baking and thereby boost his business. This will enable him to have enough stock and also bake more bread so as to meet the demand of his customers.

He hopes to expand his business by distributing bread to other towns and thereby make more profits.

loans.use: To buy more stock of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 32 years old. Enthusiasm to improve herself is one of this young woman's most important dreams. She lives with her family in their own home, and she sells catalog products such as perfumes, creams and other items. 

She has already been in the business for some time, and that has given her valuable sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits. She sells from her home and door-to-door, and is very well known by local people. She has many customers who prefer to buy from her for the quality of the products, the good prices, and especially the excellent service.

She is a determined woman, devoted to her work. Every day she does her best to secure a better future. She is planning to open a small shop to stock some products so as to improve and reduce transportation needs from place to place. This will also allow her to concentrate on supporting her customers.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of catalog products, such as perfumes and creams

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a brave, single woman. She is 24 years old and lives with her daughter who she loves with all of her heart, and for whom she fights day-to-day to get ahead. Dorothy is defined as an enterprising woman who is humble and who fights to achieve her goals. She does everything out of love for her family. She has a small kiosk where she sells basic household items and also fruits and vegetables.

The loan she has asked Yehu for will be invested in improving the store; and buying goods such as sugar, beans and wheat flour.

Dorothy's dream is to have a bigger store in the future with basic necessity products to sell in her locality.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans and wheat flour, among other goods.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
María desde niña aprendió sobre la vida laboral en la calle, a recorrer largas distancias desde que sale el sol, pues su madre trabajaba en el comercio de mariscos para sustenta su hogar. Ahora María tiene 29 años, y gracias a ese esfuerzo terminó los estudios secundarios. También ha tenido que asumir el reto de ser una madre soltera que por el bienestar de sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años no ha vacilado en trabajar cada día de su vida para poder proveer a sus hijos lo necesario para que se desempeñen de la mejor forma en la escuela y el jardín de infantes, respectivamente. Vive con sus hijos en Quinindé un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón lo que ha permitido un gran movimiento comercial en especial los fines de semana en donde salen comerciantes de todo tipo a ofertar sus productos en la feria a sus potenciales clientes que la mayoría de veces suelen ser campesinos. El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad. Cada familia de este lugar se esfuerza y busca todas las alternativas para mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que se puede hablar de un cantón emprendedor.
María se ha dedicado de lleno a la venta de pescado y mariscos desde hace 2 años. Posee un coche adecuado para poder recorrer las calles de su ciudad, proveyendo a las amas de casa este alimento que aporta proteínas y vitaminas al cuerpo y que además es demandado por ser una carne saludable. María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más productos que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes y además cumplir con la demanda de aquellos a quienes al finalizar la jornada de trabajo no les puede atender por falta de pescados o mariscos. Esta madre se esfuerza cada día por hacer un buen trabajo y así no faltar a sus hijos con ninguna de sus necesidades. María recibe la ayuda de su madre en este negocio y es el sueño de ella un día poder comprar una vivienda propia que ofrezca confort y bienestar a su familia. María se siente muy feliz por el apoyo y respaldo que Fundación Alternativa y Kiva le dan a su negocio, pues en muchas ocasiones el principal obstáculo para crecer fue la falta de capital.
texts.en:
Since she was a child, Maria has learned about the life of working on the street, traveling long distances from when the sun comes up. Her mother worked in selling seafood to support her household. Now, Maria is 29 and, thanks to that effort, finished her secondary studies. Also, she has had to assume the challenge of being a single mother that, for the well-being of her two children of 8 and 3 years old, has not hesitated to work every day of her life to be able to provide to her children what is necessary for them to perform their best in school and kindergarten, respectively. 

She lives with her children in Quinindé, a canton in the Esmeraldas province, which provides products like banana, cacao, coffee, African palm, and forest products to various cities of Ecuador. Furthermore, commerce is the daily work of the majority of its inhabitants to be able to come out ahead, and even more so when they widened the streets used travel to this canton. This has allowed great commercial movement, especially on weekends, when traders of all types go out to sell their products in the market to potential customers who are usually farmers. Tourism also is a very important contribution to this canton. Its natural ecosystem has a large variety of places to be visited: waterfalls, sweet water rivers, and forests, which have flowers and animals that adorn this city. Each family from this place makes an effort to find all the alternatives to improve their quality of life, because of which one can speak of an entrepreneurial canton.

Maria has dedicated herself fully to the sale of fish and shellfish for two years. She possesses an adequate car to be able to traverse the streets of her city, providing to the homemakers this food that provides protein and vitamins to the body, and furthermore is in demand for being a healthy meat.

Maria is applying for a loan to be able to buy more products that she can offer to her customers and in addition meet the demand of those who, in finishing the working day, she cannot serve because of the lack of fish or shellfish. This mother makes an effort every day to do a good job and thus not lack any necessities for her children. Maria receives help from her mother in this business, and it is her dream to one day be able to buy her own home, one that offers comfort and well-being to her family. Maria is very happy for the support and backing that Fundación Alternativa and Kiva give to her business. In many occasions, the principle obstacle to grow was the lack of capital.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish to increase sales.

loans.name: Bavu

texts.en:
Bavu is a married man. He describes himself to be a social man. He operates a retail shop where he sells household items. His business is located in a residential business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as high prices of household items. 


He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy household items to sell. His business goal is to run another retail store within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, he took a loan of 20,000 KES which he managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy retail items

loans.name: Jasmin Group

texts.es:
Este banco Comunal se llama “ Jazmín” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, bazar, venta de ropa, venta de aros, tejido, comida rápida, costuras, venta de joyas, restaurant, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Gloria, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en tercera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste blue jeans, blusa de color negro con adornos, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro, lo usa tomado y usa chasquillas, y en su cabeza sostiene unos lentes de sol.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja todos los días en el centro de la ciudad de Chillan en un puesto donde ofrece su mercadería fresca y buena.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en ferias o distribuidoras donde encuentra toda la fruta y mercadería fresca para ofrecerla a su clientela.
Con el crédito comprara, frutas y verduras frescas.
Una de las metas de Gloria es instalar un negocio en el antejardín de su casa, donde atienda de forma más cómoda y poder agregar otro tipo de mercadería, así con esto generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
Gloria vive junto a su esposo quien la apoya mucho en la venta de frutas y verduras. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su negocio en su casa y a nivel familiar tener buena salud para poder continuar con el rubro que le gusta mucho y atender a su clientela.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de invertir y surgir en su negocio. Gloria tiene una muy buena relación con las socias del grupo. Respecto a los cursos impartidos ha podido integrar todos los aprendizajes de venta a su negocio.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jazmin" is comprised of eighteen entrepreneurs who are involved in a variety of business activities.  These include knitting and sewing businesses, restaurants, businesses that sell jewelry, clothing and fast food, as well as other types of businesses.  All of the members are from the city of Chillán.

Gloria, the president of the communal bank, is standing in the third row of the photo and is the first person on the left.  She is wearing blue jeans and a black shirt with markings.  Her hair is dark brown, and she has bangs. There is a pair of sunglasses on top of her head.

Gloria has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years.  She reports that she works every day in the city center of Chillán in a stall where she offers good, fresh merchandise. She buys her produce and supplies from markets or distributors where she can find all the fresh fruit and other merchandise she needs to offer to her customers. With this loan she will buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

One of Gloria's goals is to establish her business in the rear of her house, where she will be able to serve her customers in a more comfortable environment.  She will also be able to add other types of merchandise and thus be able to generate more income for her family.

She lives with her husband, who supports her a great deal in her business.  Her dream is to have her business in her home, since she very much enjoys the work.  She also hopes that her family will have good health.

She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza since they have given her the opportunity to invest in and grow her business.  She has a very good relationship with the members of her community bank.  She has learned a lot from the courses offered and has been able to apply what she has learned to her business.

Chillán is a community in the southern central zone of Chile.  The name means "Seat of the Sun" in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches.  It is also known as "The Cradle of the Country" or "Land of the Artists", owing to the fact that distinguished individuals in the history of Chile have come from here, such as the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a 41-year-old entrepreneur from Kenya. She has been running a kindergarten for over ten years. She is liked by her pupils since she has all the qualities of a good mother. She has applied for a loan to start a new business; M-pesa (mobile money transfer). Her dream is to see her school expand and become a high school in future.

loans.use: to open an M-pesa business

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
El señor Armando José Chavarría es originario del municipio de Condega, un pequeño pueblo a unos 35 km al norte de Estelí y esta felizmente casado y tiene tres hijos los que ya son independientes.

El es dueño de una unidad de taxi mismo que el maneja y administra y de esta manera lleva mejor control de la unidad y brindando un mejor servicio a los clientes. El atiende todos los días de la semana desde las 7 am hasta las 10 pm y más tarde los fines de semana. Cabe mencionar que esta es su principal fuente de ingreso para el sustento de su familia. La esposa de el labora como empleada en la alcaldía de este mismo municipio quien también aporta al sustento del hogar.

solicita a Ceprodel un crédito con el objetivo de mejorar la unidad de taxi que el tiene, consiste en la compra de las llantas del vehículo y el mantenimiento mecánico periódico que debe realizarse y que el vehículo siempre se mantenga en buenas condiciones lo que le permitirá dar un buen servicio de lo que depende directamente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Armando José Chavarría is from Condega, a small village some 35 kilometers north of Estelí.  He is happily married and has three grown children.

He is the owner of a taxi business, and he drives the taxi himself.  This allows him greater control of the business and enables him to bring better service to his customers.  He works every day of the week from 7 am to 10 pm, and even later on weekends.  He reports that this is his main source of income to support his family.  His wife works in the mayor's office in Condega and also contributes to the household expenses.

He is seeking a loan from Ceprodel so that he can make improvements to his taxi.  He needs to buy tires and to perform periodic maintenance.  By maintaining his vehicle in consistently good condition, he will be be able to provide better service, which directly impacts his income.

loans.use: to buy tires and perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
Cadith, de 50 años, es una mujer muy amable, trabajadora y muy perseverante, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia y es a ellos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Cadith consiste en la compra y venta de vehículos, principalmente de mototaxis ya que en algunas ocasiones también compra motos. Ella está atenta a la llegada de algún vendedor para ofrecerle un precio justo, cuando adquiere los vehículos los restaura y los deja en buenas condiciones con ayuda de su hijo, luego los vende o financia a precios cómodos, tiene su local en su casa en donde realiza este trabajo desde hace 2 años.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos a parte de darle el tiempo suficiente para poder realizar otras actividades, trabaja solo y tiene como planes muchas cosas, pero por mientras solo desea seguir trabajando hasta juntar el capital suficiente para poder poner una tienda de repuestos y vende vehiculo nuevos. Este es el préstamo número 16 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo económico a través de la oportunidad que le brindan ya que así podrá concretar algunos planes que tiene para su negocio, por otro lado se compromete a seguir siendo una socia responsable y a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual como hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará piezas, repuestos y lona de tapizado para arreglar 2 mototaxis que tiene en espera para venderlos.
texts.en:
Cadith is 50 years old and is very kind, hardworking and persevering.  She is a widow with five children who live with her in her house.  She wants to give her children a better quality of life.

Cadith works buying and selling vehicles, primarily mototaxis but sometimes also motorcycles.  She is always alert for the arrival of a new vender that may offer her a fair price.  When she acquires vehicles, she restores them to good condition with the help of her son.  She then sells or finances them at affordable prices.  She has been in this business for two years, and she runs it out of her house.

She likes what she does very much because it allows her to earn a good income while at the same time pursue other activities.  She works alone and has many plans for the future, but for now she would like to keep working until she has put sufficient capital together to be able to have a shop in which she would sell spare parts and new vehicles.

This is Cadith’s 16th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has economic support through the opportunity they have given her.  In this way she can make concrete plans for her business.  On the other hand, she promises to continue being a responsible member and to continue making her payments in a timely manner as she has done with previous loans.

With the requested 3500 nuevos soles she will buy spare parts and upholstery canvas to fix two mototaxis so that she can sell them.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and upholstery canvas to fix two mototaxis so that she can sell them.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is taking out a new loan to invest in her charcoal-selling business, which she has run for some time. She narrates that she also owns her motorcycle. She decided to open a charcoal-selling business, so as to diversify her lines of operation and earn more income. 

Emma is grateful for the previous support given, with which she was able to re-stock her retail shop that she also runs. Her aim is to own several businesses, in order to have more financial security.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old. He is from Nakuru and married with two children, who are aged between seven years and two years old.

Joseph has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past four years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy another motorbike. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan, and he will be in a position to employ one person.

He hopes to buy a rickshaw to add to his transportation business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria used his previous loan to buy more charcoal to sell. It was profitable since he made more income, which helped him provide for the needs of his family.

He plans to use this loan to buy another motorcycle, and thereby, boost his motorcycle business. He anticipates generating more income, with which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to invest more in his transportation business by buying more motorcycles. He also hopes to buy a plot and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa Danila

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en una colonia de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella tiene 4 años de haber establecido un negocio de venta de mercadería como ropa clasificada, zapatos, tenis y botines, además vende jugos y golosinas. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo a ODEF y es por 9,000 Lempiras, los cuales invertirá en la compra de ropa y calzado.
El préstamo le ayudara a tener disponibilidad de efectivo para atender los encargos de sus clientes. Su plan es crecer más con el negocio, para terminar de darles la educación a sus hijos y hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Rosa, 49, is married and has two children.  She lives in a San Pedro Sula neighborhood with her husband and children.  She started her business selling clothes, shoes, tennis shoes and ankle boots four years ago; she also sells juice and snacks.  She’s asked for a third cycle in ODEF for 9,000 Lempiras to buy clothes and shoes.  The loan will help her have cash on-hand to fill customer orders.  Her plan is to grow more in business to finish providing education for her children and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Misael

texts.es: Carlos Misael 32  años, casado con dos hijos menos de edad 14 y 4 años estudiantes de primaria, su negocio consiste en la venta de mercadería en general (tipo liniero), ventas de ropa nueva variadas, productos plásticos, como también fajas, entre otros accesorios, negocio el cual tiene ya 3 años  de realizar esta labor, él no tiene un lugar fijo del negocio por lo que  es ambulante, originario de Chichigalpa ciudad donde predomina el ron, la caña y azúcar, pero su clientela ha incrementado que se ha esparcido por todos lados. Carlos uno de sus deseo  es el de mejorar su casa donde vive, al igual que ampliar aún más su negocio.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de mercadería como: compra de  ropa de niños, adultos, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, short, faldas, juegos de cama, juegos de toallas, ropa interior, artículos plásticos variados y así satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, y en un futuro no lejano poder aumentar sus ingresos. Carlos Misael  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Carlos Misael, 32, is married and has two minor children who are 14 and 4 years of age and who attend elementary school.  His business consists in selling general merchandise.  He sells assorted new clothes, plastic items and belts, among other accessories.  He’s been in business three years.  He does not have a fixed locale; he sells from place to place.  He’s from Chichigalpa where rum, sugarcane and sugar predominate.  His clientele has increases because he’s gone everywhere.  One of Carlos’ desires is to improve the house he lives in as well as to expand the business more.  This loan’s objective is to invest in working capital and stock the business buying merchandise like children’s clothes, adult clothes, pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, bed linens, towel sets, underwear, varied plastic items to meet customer demand and in a not too distant future increase his income.  Carlos Misael is thankful for the support Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a way to earn their livelihood with dignity.

loans.use: pto buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Soila Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Soila Cristina esta casada, tiene 30 años de edad, cursó solamente 1 año la educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la atención de un tienda en general, iniciando  este negocio con la venta de papas fritas que lleva 7 años de experiencia, ahora quiere apertura una tienda con variedad de productos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Solicita un préstamo que sera invertido para la compra de productos de consumo diario, para una tienda que van a aperturar, va comprar golosinas, lácteos, aguas gaseosa, agua pura, jugos; espera en el futuro tenga un negocio amplio y con muchos clientes, y mejorar sus ingresos de ganancias.
texts.en: Soila is a 30 year old married woman who only attended primary school for one year.  She has two children, one of whom is studying.  She has a general store and started her business selling French fries.  She has seven years of experience and now she wishes to open a store with a variety of products.  She has the support of her husband, who is a weaver.  The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of staple goods for the store that she plans to open.  She will buy candies, milk, soda water, spring water, and juice.  In the future, she hopes to have a large business with many customers and improve her profits.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods such as candies, milk, soda water, spring water, and juice.

loans.name: Nerith

texts.es:
Nerith, de 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jeremías de 54 años, tiene 4 hijos pero vive únicamente con la última de todos ellos y es por ella por quien trabaja arduamente para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Nerith consiste en la venta de flores por unidad o en arreglos florales de mayor vistosidad. Trabaja todos los fines de semana en un cementerio ubicado a 15 kilómetros de la ciudad. Instala su puesto colocando todas sus flores en baldes con agua, ofrece a la venta especies como claveles, girasoles, gladiolos, azucenas, lirios, violetas y las infaltables rosas en diversos colores. Trabaja sola ya que su actividad no requiere de realizar un gran esfuerzo físico. Lleva ya 7 años con este negocio y le esta yendo muy bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues disfruta de conversar con otras vendedoras al mismo tiempo que ofrece sus flores a las diversas personas que entran a visitar las tumbas y mausoleos de sus familiares, todavía no se siente realizada, ya que desea poner una tienda dedicada solo a la venta de flores, ya que siente que es momento de empezar a crecer y tener un local propio. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por ello agradece la confianza que ponen en ella para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y responsable como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo, además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios entre sí.
Con los 2500 soles solicitados, comprará más flores para surtir mejor su negocio y incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nerith, 54, is a very kind, hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Jeremías, 54.  She has four children but only the youngest one of them still lives with her and she works hard to provide her with a better quality of life.

Nerith’s work consists in selling flowers both individually and in very eye-catching flower arrangements.  She works every weekend at a cemetery located 15 kilometers from the city.  She sets up her stand with her flowers in buckets of water and sells such species like carnations, sunflowers, gladioli, lilies, Easter lilies, violets and the not-to-be-forgotten roses in various colors.  She works alone because her work does not require much physical effort.  She’s been in business 7 years and is doing very well.

She likes her work very much because she enjoys chatting with the other vendors while offering her flowers to various people who come by to visit graves or family crypts.  She does not yet feel fulfilled because she still wants to have a flower shop and feels that this is the right moment to start growing to have a shop of her own.

This is MFP loan #4 and she’s grateful for the trust placed in her so she can continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits to continue being a punctual and responsible member like she’s been with the previous loans she’s gotten.  She also wants to continue working with the members of her communal bank because they are all kind and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy more flowers to stock her business and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
Sorie is a 29-year-old man. He was born in Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone, where he currently lives. He is single with one child. Sorie is a businessman and has been a businessman for three years now. He sells plastic bagged water/drinks. 

Sorie has requested a loan of 6,000,000 Leones from Kiva field partner, Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy a large quantity of plastic bagged water/drinks to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of plastic-bagged water/drinks to add to his current stock

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as a humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells mattresses. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a general public area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances to expand her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy mattresses to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy mattresses to sell

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es: María, tiene 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia de san Pedro Sula. hace tres años que María inicio su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como azúcar, arroz, pan, refrescos, churros, carnes, lácteos, productos de limpieza etc. ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a ODEF por 11,000 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería de productos comestibles y la mayor parte en útiles escolares para aprovechar la temporada escolar. Ella tiene como plan seguir con el negocio para obtener ingresos que le permitan ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio y poder mejorar su vivienda con las ganancias que genere.
texts.en: María, 43, is married and has three children.  She lives in a San Pedro Sula neighborhood.  She opened her own grocery store three years ago where she sells basic family staple items like sugar, rice, bread, soft-drinks, snacks, meats, dairy products, cleaning supplies, etc.  She’s decided to request a new, 11,000 Lempira, loan from ODEF to stock the store with food items but most of it will be used to buy school supplies to take advantage of the school term.  Her plan is to stay in business to earn income that will make it possible for her to help pay for her children’s schooling and to use profits generated to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Alva

texts.es: Alva, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, además de amable y cordial.  Es conviviente con Alexander quien es empleado y padre de sus 3 hijos: Nilda de 17 años, Patrik de 8 años y Belén de 5 años de edad. Vive en compañía de su pareja e hijos, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa, la cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Alva es la costura y confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional.  Para empezar compró una maquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su propia casa donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por los detalles que aplica a cada prenda, a logrado ganarse la aceptación de sus clientes habituales quienes la recomiendan con otros clientes. Se inició hace 2 años en éste negocio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando ella sola. Considera rentable su actividad por las ganancias que le deja. Le gusta la costura porque le permite mantenerse ocupada en todo momento, además las ganancias que le deja le sirve para apoyar a su pareja en solventar los gastos de su hogar. Pero comenta que le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico que tiene en ocasiones debido a que pasa muchas horas sentada, a pesar de ello, no se desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y comprarse otras maquinas de coser para poder tener un mejor acabo en su costura. Este es el  préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de  poder contar con un capital de trabajo gracias a la institución, así poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y colaborador. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles,  comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, agujas, botones, blondas, elásticos, aplicaciones y otros de acuerdo al requerimiento de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alva, 40, is a cheerful woman with a strong wish for self-improvement in addition to being kind and gracious.  She lives with Alexander who is employed and the father of their three children: Nilda, 17, Patrik, 8 and Belén, 5. She lives with her spouse and children comfortably installed in her own house that she built with much effort.  

Alva’s activity is sewing and dressmaking; she makes clothes for women, men and children, an occupation she learned at an occupational education center.  To start off, she used her savings to buy a sewing machine that she set up at home where she takes care of customers who seek her out because of the detail work she does on garments.  She’s won over regular customers who recommend her to others.  She started the business two years ago and to date has been doing it alone.

She considers her work to be profitable because of the profits it nets.  She likes sewing because it keeps her busy all the time and the profits she earns from it make it possible for her to help her spouse cover household expenses.  But she comments that she does find having to sit in the same position for long periods of time physically exhausting but that does not discourage her and she continues working and striving.  She plans to stay in business and buy more sewing machines to do even better work.

This is MFP loan #13 and she feels happy to be able to count on working capital thanks to the institution so that she can complete her pending customer orders.  She’s also comfortable in her communal bank because she considers it to be a united, collaborative group.  She will use the requested 2,500 new soles to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, needles, buttons, trim, elastic, applications and others according to customer requirements.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like fabric, needles, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en:
Yamah is 32 years old, and lives in Jacob Town, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County.  She is single, with a two-year-old child that is in school, and lives at home with her.

Yaham has been involved with the sales of vita, oil, salt, seasoned oil, rice, and black pepper for past four years.  She says there is not much buying during the rainy season. She started this business with the help of her boyfriend, who give her some money. 

Her main goal is to send her child to school, and take care of her home. 

Yamah has requested this loan to purchase more vita, oil, salt, seasoned oil, rice, and black pepper.  She hopes to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, oil, salt, seasoned oil, rice, and black pepper to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 49 years old, a widow, and a mother of four children aged 23, 17, 15 and eight. She operates a plastic recycling business that provides a monthly income of KES 45,000, and she has been in the business for the last year.

She has acquired a second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more raw materials to use in her business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

She hopes to expand her business into a big plastic manufacturing plant in future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for plastic recycling

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 47 years old and from Nakuru. He is married with two children who are aged 17 and 14 years old.

He has a grocery store, which he has been running for the past 17 years. He has applied for his first loan to enable him to buy onions, tomatoes, and potatoes for sale to add to his stock.

He hopes to buy a tractor in the near future.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet  is a 30-year-old married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be an independent, determined and humble man. 

He operates a motorcycle, which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located near a busy market, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy spare motorcycle parts. 

His business goal is to run a garage for motorcycle spare parts within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en: The desire to get ahead is one of the many goals Dometila has. She has operated a restaurant for several years which has enabled her to gain sales experience. She is asking for another loan through Yehu to renovate her business premises. She wants to buy iron sheets, assorted nails, timber, etc. Dometila is grateful for the loan she got and she hopes to expand her business after this investment due to increased number of clients.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, assorted nails, timber, etc

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 52 years old and from Ndunyu in Kenya. She is married with one child who is 13 years old and in class seven of Upper Primary School.

She has been a farmer for the past 30 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy farm inputs like maize seedlings,fertilizers and also pay school fees for her child.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future and educate her child well.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 36 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as humble and hard working . She operates a restaurant where she sells tea, food and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to run a big hotel within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: Aracelly De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Aracelly una humilde joven de 26 años de edad, originaria de León, soltera, con conocimientos académicos de secundaria,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica  a la venta de ropa y perfumes Avon desde hace 6 años. Inicio desde muy joven en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo ropa  a la edad de 20 años la cual con esfuerzo propio ha podido sacar adelante su negocio, este ha sido su primer negocio, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su tía quien le ayuda a administrar su negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar una línea solo de ropa para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar más ropa  como blusas, faldas, vestidos, etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito  le ayudaría a crecer en inventario de su  ropa, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es poder agregar más productos que ofertar a sus clientes, sus metas próxima es poder cancelar este crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro
texts.en:
Aracelly, 26, is a humble, young woman from León.  She’s single and attended secondary school.  She’s a merchant by profession; she has been selling clothes and Avon perfume for six years.  She started out in commerce when still very young at the age of 20 selling clothes.  With much effort she’s succeeded in moving her business forward.  This has been her first business and her aunt helps her manage it.  Her expectation is to expand only one clothing line to satisfy customer needs.

She’s requesting financing to buy more clothes like blouses, skirts, dresses, etc. because she feels this loan will help her expand her clothing inventory aiming at increasing sales to earn higher profits.   Her future plan is to be able to add more products to offer her customers and her short-term goal is to be able to repay this loan to then request another one.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Eliu De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Eliu un humilde señor de 36 años de edad, originario  del Sauce, Municipio de León, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 1 y 11 años respectivamente, actualmente solo uno está estudiando el otro todavía no tiene edad para estudiar, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio, ayudándoles a otras personas  en un cafetín en donde adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, fue allí que decidió emprender su otro negocio de cafetín, el cual lo comenzó con capital propio, a la edad  de 30 años,  sus expectativas es hacer ampliar  su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar toda la mercadería en general tales como shampo, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, pan, cremas, etc. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar  productos que aún no tiene en existencia como sillas, mesas, para ofrecerles mejor comodidad a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura del  local en donde tiene su negocio de cafetín, para darle una mejor presentación al negocio, con el propósito de hacer crecer  el negocio para que le genere mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Eliu is a humble, 36-year-old man from Sauce, León Municipality.  He’s married and father of two children who are 1 and 11 years old respectively.  Only one of them is currently in school, the other one isn’t old enough for school yet.  He’s a merchant in the grocery store business.  He started out in commerce helping others in a snack bar where he gained experience and total business savvy.  That was when he decided to start another snack bar business that he started with his own capital when he was 30-years-old.  His expectation is to expand the business to earn higher profits.

He’s asking for financing to buy all the general merchandise like shampoo, rice, sugar, beans, soap, bread, cream, etc. because he feels that this loan will help him buy products like tables and chairs he still does not have thus providing better comfort for his customers.  His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of the locale his snack bar is located in to give the business improved appearance aiming at making the business grow so that it will generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old woman. All her days she has not been to school. She is married with five children between the ages of 6 months and 17 years. They all live in the capital city (Monrovia) of Montserrado County. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past eight years, Rose has been selling palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, Vita (juice drink), etc. in the local market. She spends eight hours on her business. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She really enjoys the movement of her customers.

Rose is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, Vita, etc. to expand her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.
.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, Vita, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Fraciah

texts.en:
Fraciah is 37 years old and married with four children who are between two and 14 years old. 

Fraciah has a farming business that she has been running for the past 10 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a heifer to add to her stock of animals.

She hopes to own a piece of land in the near future and be able to educate her children well.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is twenty nine years old. He is a married man with one child living in Kasese,Uganda. For the past three years he has been a teacher. He was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people. He also has a brick making project to supplement his meager salary. His personal goal is to upgrade his studies while his business plan is to expand his brick project. Charles intends to use the loan to pay employees who are helping him in brick making.

loans.use: to pay employees who are helping him in making bricks.

loans.name: Mandalina

texts.en: Mandalina is a 59 year old married woman. She has 5 children ranging in age ranging from 10 to 36 years old. She describes herself as a faithful and caring woman . She operates a farm where she sells bananas (ripe and raw). She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a favorable business environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand the business. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy banana trees. Her business goal is to be the biggest supplier of bananas in her town  within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy banana trees for planting

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is taking out a new loan to expand his business. He has a many years of experience selling animals. Thanks to his efforts, his family has not lacked any basic necessities. With this new loan, he plans to buy more goats to sell. He has also been able to open a small business where he sells scrap metal. Both businesses are doing well. 

Thanks for your support!

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Karen Johana

texts.es:
Doña Karen Johana,  reside en el municipio de Nindirí perteneciente al  departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 34 años, de oficio comerciante.

 Su núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposo, su  pequeña hija y ella. 
Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa usada y una pequeña Pulpería, lo inicio  hace 2 años con su propio capital que provenían de unos ahorros que ella tenia, esto lo inicia con el propósito de colaborar con los ingresos del hogar y poder contar con un bienestar económico, la compras de su negocio de ropa las realiza en el mercado oriental de Managua, sus clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes. 

 Actualmente  esta necesitando invertirle más a su negocio para la compra de pacas de ropa usada y bisutería y así  poder reabastecer su negocio, por lo que esta solicitando a ceprodel un financiamiento que le permita ofrecer variedad en su negocio, considera que esta ayuda le dará mejores condiciones de vida y le brindara una mejor educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Karen Johana lives in the municipality of Nindirí, part of the Masaya department. She is 34 years old and works as a vendor.

Her immediate family is comprised of her husband, her young daughter, and herself. 

Her business is selling used clothing, as well as running a small convenience store. She started it two years ago with her own money, which came from some savings that she had. She started the business with the hope of being able to contribute towards the household income and to be able to have financial security. She makes her clothing purchases at the market in Managua, and her customers are her neighbors and passers-by.

Currently she needs to invest more in her business to buy bundles of used clothing and jewelry to be able to stock up her business. This is why she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to enable her to offer more variety. She believes that this help will give her a better quality of life and will allow her to give her daughter a better education.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 31-year-old lady and is married to Nicholus, who is a clerk at a conservancy firm. She is a mother of two children aged five years old and six months old. Sylvia operates a bakery in Narok town and has been in the business for the last year earning a monthly income of KES 80,000.

She has acquired her first loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase an additional baking tray to expand her bread and cake business. She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business as well as to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business into a large outlet.

loans.use: to purchase an additional baking tray

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro José de 55 años de edad, del municipio de  León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Pedro es un hombre trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor es que, y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicamentos genéricos de forma ambulante, el cual consiste en vender acetaminofén, alkaD alkazelcer , migratil, ácido mefenamico, dorival, novalgina, amoxicilina. La rutina diaria de Pedro es trabajar unas 10 horas ofreciendo sus productos en diferentes lugares de su región a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de medicamento, para ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro no lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Pedro José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro José, 55, is from the municipality of León, a place located in the west of the country.  Pedro is a hardworking, responsible man with a desire for personal growth.  Thanks to his enterprising spirit and his drive to get ahead, his economic activity is selling generic medicine from place to place.  He sells acetaminophen, Alka-AD [anti-diarrheal], Alka-Seltzer, Migratil [migraine remedy], mefenamic acid [non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug], Dorival [brand of ibuprofen], Novalgina [a powerful analgesic and antipyretic], Amoxicillin [anti-bacterial].  Pedro’s daily routine is to work about 10 hours selling his products to regular and occasional customers in various places in his region.

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital to stock his business buying and selling medicine to provide better customers service and in a not too distant future earn higher income.  Pedro José is grateful to Kiva investors for the help they give people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Fran

texts.en:
Fran is 39 years old and has three children; twelve, seven and five years old with two of them attending school. Fran and his family live in northeast Albania, in a little community.

While he has been selling low-priced clothing for the past eighteen years in his community, he has also been selling in the neighboring villages by transporting those items with his own vehicle. “Sales of such items go smoothly here, because people are very poor and cannot afford buying better ones,” Fran said.

Recently, the vehicle that he uses for transportating his clothing broke down, and he needs to repair it. As the only financial provider for his family, he said that “it is impossible” to save this much money. Thus, Fran is applying for a loan through Kiva to repair the vehicle.

loans.use: To repair the transportation vehicle that he uses for his business

loans.name: Hugo Edilberto

texts.es: Hugo Edilberto a sus 43 años de edad, casado con dos hijos de 8 y 9 años, ambos estudiantes de primaria, los cuales  están bajo su responsabilidad estudiando. Él es originario de Somotillo  lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de occidente del país. Hugo es una persona muy trabajadora, este negocio lo inicia por herencia porque su papa estudio y vendió medicina alternativa de esa manera el aprende el negocio lamentablemente el solo logra estudiar 3 años por falta de recursos económico en su hogar, actualmente tiene 22 años de trabajar en este negocio, compra y venta de medicina natural (alternativa) de manera ambulante y domiciliar, el realiza sus compras al contado y sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito en municipios del norte del país, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  en la compra de medicina natural como: suelda con suelda, limpia colon, cascara sagrada, linaza, lumba grasa, entre otros  y asi  brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro cercano aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Hugo Edilberto, 43, is married and has two children who are 8 and 9 years of age, both elementary school students who are in his care and attending school.  He’s from Somotillo, a place located in the northwest part of the country.  Hugo is a very hardworking person.  He started the business as an inheritance from his father.  He studied and sold alternative medicine and this is how he learned the business.  Unfortunately, he was only able to study for three years because of the lack of economic resources at home.  He’s currently been working in this business for 22 years.  He buys and sells natural (alternative) medicine from place to place and door-to-door.  He pays cash for his purchases and sells for cash and on credit in the municipalities in the north of the country.  The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital buying natural remedies like: Suelda con Suelda [cream], colon cleanser, sacred bark, flax and fat burner, among others to provide better customer service and improve his income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy alternative natural remedies.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a fishmonger who sells fresh fish in Enyinase near Elmina. She has received no formal education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a businessman in the community. 

Abigail has been selling fresh fish for the past four years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband and child. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for sale. 

Abigail hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her fish selling trade.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Angostura Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Nuevo Horizonte de Angostura” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de pasteles, venta de ropa, venta de productos plásticos, venta de productos de belleza, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Karina, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste polera de color verde, su cabello es de color castaño claro y  lo usa largo y tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de confección, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja dia por medio, en su casa tiene un pequeño taller que lo ubica en el living de su casa, trabaja por pedidos de su clientela, a domicilio y a familiares.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para sus confecciones de manteles y cortinas, las compra en la cuidad de Santiago, ya que encuentra gran variedad de géneros y colores a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará géneros y una maquina overlock usada.
Una de las metas de Karina es hacer una pieza y ubicar su taller como corresponde y dejar su living despejado, y así atender a su clientela de manera más satisfactoria.
Karina vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 12, 8 un año de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es creer con su negocio para genera mayores ingresos y darles un buen futuro escolar a sus hijos.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizante de Angostura”. It is composed of 17 entrepreneurs who work in various fields, among which are: selling cakes, clothing sales, selling plastic products, selling beauty products, and services, among others. All of them live in the city of Rancagua.

Karina, a member of the communal bank, is in the photo standing in the second row and second from the right. She is wearing a green shirt; her hair is light brown and she wears it long and braided. 

She has worked in tailoring for 1 year. She says that she works during the day in her house. She has a small shop located in the living room of her house. She takes orders from her customers, relatives, and does deliveries.

She purchases the merchandise and supplies that she needs to make blankets and curtains in the city of Santiago, as she can find a wide variety of merchandise and colors at a low cost, and therefore it’s economically convenient.

With the loan, she will buy merchandise and a used Overlock sewing machine.

One of Karina’s goals is to build a room, relocate her shop as is fitting and clear out her living room, and therefore attend to her customers in a more satisfactory way.

Karina lives with her husband and three children ages 12, 8, and 1 years. Her dreams on a work level are to believe in her business in order to generate more income and give her children a better educational future. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. 

With respect to the communal bank group which she is a part of, she says that within it, there exists very good communication. On the other hand, the trainings have helped her to learn new sales and bookkeeping strategies.

Rancagua belongs to the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins region. It’s a modern city that regulates the main agricultural production and exportation process for fruit and wine grapes in Chile. It is also a mining city, due to the fact that in its mountain range is found the largest subterranean mine in the world, “El Teniente,” with 4,500 kilometers of tunnels.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a used Overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 2 and 5 years. He describes himself to be an honest man.

Harun operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within an urban area, and his primary customers are general people from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Harun will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy suits to sell. 

His business goal is to buy a sewing machine within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had expanded his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. Harun does teaching, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy suits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 52-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 2 years to 29 years. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a strategically placed business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs used to transport clothing materials. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a financially independent businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Mary does tailoring which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit for sale in the market.

loans.name: David Rafael

texts.es:
David un  humilde joven con deseo de superación, de  24 años de edad, originario de la capital de  Managua, soltero, se dedica a estudiar en la universidad, su mama es padre y madre al mismo tiempo, la cual le ayuda en sus estudios. David está culminando su último quinto año de la carrera de Derecho, él nos cuenta que escogió esta carrera porque le gusta y además le da la oportunidad de salir adelante, ya que  le ayuda a tener un cargo más alto como profesional él trabaja dando su servicio de policía y de esta manera ayuda a la sociedad.
Él quiere utilizar el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación y poder graduarse de la carrera de Derecho.
